Clockwork dragons are a marvel of clockwork design. These powerful masterpieces have the ability to fly, making them versatile and dangerous killers. A clockwork dragon's winding mechanism is more efficient than those of other clockworks, allowing it to partially reuse energy generated by flapping its wings. Creating a clockwork dragon requires not only an advanced understanding of clockwork design, but also a greater cache of rare resources, as its body requires solid reinforcement. As a result, most clockwork dragons have adamantine fortification. Creating a clockwork dragon without adamantine is entirely possible, though such dragons are typically smaller and more fragile. **[Recall Knowledge - Construct](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2), [Crafting](/Skills.aspx?ID=4)): DC 40 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 38 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 35 [Clockwork Dragon](/Monsters.aspx?ID=1098) **Source** [Bestiary 3](/Sources.aspx?ID=66) pg. 51 **Perception** +28; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) **Languages** **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +29, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +33 **Str** +9 **Dex** +5 **Con** +5 **Int** -5 **Wis** +4 **Cha** -5 **Wind-Up** 1 week, DC 35, standby --- **AC** 39 **Fort** +30 **Ref** +28 **Will** +25 **HP** 265 **Immunities** [death](/Traits.aspx?ID=40) effects, [disease](/Traits.aspx?ID=46), [doomed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=9), [drained](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10), [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=15), [healing](/Traits.aspx?ID=89), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=188) attacks, [paralyzed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=28), [poison](/Traits.aspx?ID=126), [sickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=34), [unconscious](/Conditions.aspx?ID=38) **Resistances** physical 15 (except [adamantine](/Equipment.aspx?ID=374) or orichalcum) **Weaknesses** electricity 15, [orichalcum](/Equipment.aspx?ID=378) 15 **Self-Destruct** A clockwork dragon must use this reaction unless specifically programmed otherwise by its creator; **Trigger** The clockwork dragon is reduced to 0 Hit Points; **Effect** The dragon screeches to a stop and emits a steady, loud ticking sound. At the beginning of what would have been its next turn, the dragon explodes, dealing 12d10 piercing damage in a 40-foot emanation (DC 37 basic Reflex save).
An adjacent creature can cancel the self-destruct sequence by succeeding at a DC 37 [Thievery](/Skills.aspx?ID=17) check to [Disable a Device](/Actions.aspx?ID=69). --- **Speed** 40 feet, fly 120 feet **Melee** adamantine jaws +33 ([reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d12+17 piercing **Melee** adamantine claw +33 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d8+17 slashing **Melee** tail +31 ([reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 3d12+15 bludgeoning **Melee** wing +31 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 2d10+15 piercing **Breath Weapon** ([Arcane](/Traits.aspx?ID=11), [Evocation](/Traits.aspx?ID=65), [Fire](/Traits.aspx?ID=72)) **Effect** The clockwork dragon breathes a spray of flaming oil that deals 16d6 fire damage in a 40-foot cone (DC 37 basic Reflex save). Creatures that fail their saves are covered in burning oil and take 2d6 [persistent fire damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29). The clockwork dragon can't use Breath Weapon again for 2 rounds. **Draconic Frenzy** The clockwork dragon makes two claw Strikes and one wing Strike in any order. **Spearing Tail** The clockwork dragon attacks with the sharp point of its tail. It makes a tail Strike against each creature in a 20-foot line, rolling the attack roll once and applying the result to each target. Any creature hit takes 4d6 [persistent bleed damage](/Conditions.aspx?ID=29) (doubled on a critical hit). This counts as two attacks for the dragon's multiple attack penalty.
